alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:02PM EST until February 01 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Des Plaines River near Russell affecting Lake IL County. Fox River at Dayton affecting La Salle County. Kankakee River at Momence affecting Kankakee County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Iroquois River near Foresman affecting Newton County. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Lake IN and Newton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near US-41 downstream to confluence with Sugar Creek at Watseka, including the Iroquois gauge. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural areas near the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.7 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. River ice is affecting water levels across the area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. River ice may also cause gauge observations to be inaccurate. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued byMonday afternoon at noon CST.
